column1:
cebu city public information office added a new photo — in philippines.
august 2 at 10:38 am ·
more options

base sa datos gikan sa cebu city vaccination operations center (voc), moabot na sa 187,524 ang total administered doses sa coronavirus disease 2019 (covid-19) vaccines dinhi sa dakbayan sa sugbo sukad niadtong marso 24, 2021 hangtod agosto 2, 2021.

today’s segment of uswag, pinas! special edition highlights the ongoing vaccination program in cebu city as the local government and medical frontliners strive to achieve population protection against the coronavirus disease 2019 (covid-19), especially with the emergence of new variants of the virus and the imposition of modified enhanced community quarantine (mecq) in the city.

derived from the bisayan term ‘uswag’ which means progress, this special edition of the social media program aims to inform viewers about the ongoing mass immunization in different communities across the nation, the tireless efforts of healthcare workers and medical frontliners in battling the public health crisis, and interviews from inoculated filipinos and medical experts on the benefits of getting the jab to further boost vaccine confidence amongst the people.

uswag, pinas! special edition is a flagship program of the presidential broadcast staff – radio television malacañang (rtvm).

#uswagpinas
#vacctonormal
#resbakuna
#jabjabjab
#jabwelldone
#goodjab

ayaw kalimot, magpabakuna gyod ta!

gihangyo ang mga molopyo sa cebu city sa pagpaabot lang una sa dugang announcement sa city government kabahin sa schedule sa pagpamakuna.

gibisita ni cebu city acting mayor michael rama ang cebu city quarantine center (ccqc) karung adlawa, huwebes, agusto 5, 2021.

matod ni rama ang cebu city government padayong nagmonitor sa atong temporary treatment monitoring facility sama sa ccqc nga karun anaa gipahiluna ang mga covid patients nga mga residente sa dakbayan sa sugbo.

sa kasamtangan, ang ccqc adunay 149 ka pasyente nga mild, moderate, severe symptoms sa covid-19 lakip niini ang dialysis patients.

cebu city acting mayor michael rama visited cebu city quarantine center (ccqc) today, thursday, august 5, 2021.

rama said the cebu city government is continuously monitoring our temporary treatment monitoring facility like ccqc which is now available to keep covid patients who are residents of cebu city.

meanwhile, ccqc has 149 patients with mild, moderate, severe symptoms of covid-19 including dialysis patients.

hugot nga gipatuman sa cebu city transportation office (ccto) ang 75% nga kapasidad sa pampublikong mga sakyanan nga nagbiyahian dinhi sa dakbayan sa sugbo.

kini subay usab sa kamandoan sa iatf aron pagkontrolar sa padayong pagkatap sa covid-19 ilabina karon nga duna nay nakasulod nga kaso sa delta variant sa syudad.

sa mga violators nga madakpan sama sa driver, konduktor o pasahero, mahimo kamong ma-balhog ug makamulta adto sa cogon ramos gym samtang sa south area adto sa labangon gym.

ang mga modern jeepneys, kinahanglan abli ang pultahan ug bintana samtang ang taxi abli ang mga bintana 3-5 inches.

sa mga pasahero , kinahanglan nga magsul-ob flfacemask, faceshield ug valid id maoy dalhon pirme sa inyong paglakaw-lakaw.

awhag sa ccto ang pagtinabangay sa tanan kay para raman kin isa atong kaluwasan niining giatubang karon nga pandemya.

kumustahin ang sitwasyon ng mga kababayan natin sa probinsya ng cebu ngayong patuloy na kinahaharap ng bansa ang panganib na banta ng delta variant kasama si talisay city mayor samsam gullas jr.

at pederasyon ng sangguniang kabataan sa talisay city, abala sa pagsasagawa ng iba't ibang aktibidad at programa para sa kanilang komunidad.

kinig-nood kasama si pcoo secretary martin andanar.

#secmartinandanar
#martinandanar
#nbnewsph #dutertelegacy #senbonggo
ania ang mga hotlines nga mamahimong tawagan kon duna mo'y mga covid-19 related concerns gikan sa cebu city emergency operations center.

president rodrigo roa duterte convenes several cabinet members to discuss the latest government response on the covid-19 situation as the national capital region (ncr) will be placed under enhanced community quarantine (ecq) from august 6-20, 2021 due to the rising number of covid-19 cases and emergence of the delta variant among these cases.

amid the stricter quarantine classification, president duterte stresses the need to ramp up the government’s vaccination efforts. with around 22 million doses of vaccines expected to arrive in august, he vows to deliver vaccines even in far-flung areas when the country receives enough doses.

during the meeting, department of public works and highways (dpwh) secretary mark villar reports the accomplishments of the build, build, build program, highlighting both the completed and ongoing flagship infrastructure programs under president duterte’s administration.

gipahibaw sa cebu city vaccination operations center nga magpadayon ang pagbakuna sa syudad sa mga vaccination sites niini sugod ugmang adlawa, agosto 2, 2021 bisan pa man sa mecq status sa tibuok sugbo.

apan strikto nga ipatuman ang no walk in policy. kadtong mga nakadawat lang sa text message sa ilang schedule ang mamahimong mogawas aron makapabakuna.

kadtong mga nka-rehistro na nga wala pa makadawat og text message gihangyo nga maghuwat lang una samtang padayon ang pagsuta sa syudad niini.

sa wala pa makaparehistro, mamahimong makarehistro sa pabakunata.com.

cebu city vaccination operations center announced that the city's vaccination sites will continue starting today, august 2, 2021 despite mecq status throughout cebu.

but strictly apply the no walk in policy. those who just received a text message on their schedule will go out so they can get vaccinated. \ n

those who have already registered and haven't received a text message are asked to wait as the city continues to check.

before you haven't registered, please register at pabakunata.com.

gisugdan na sa mga sakop sa cebu city covid action team ang mas hugot pa nga pagpatuman sa health protocol sa tibuok syudad sa unang adlaw sa pagpatuman sa mecq.

gisuroy sa team nga gipanguluhan ni probe chief raquel arce ang dalan colon aron pahimangnuan ang publiko kabahin sa mga lagda sa syudad.

hangyo sa mga sakop sa cebu city covid action team nga magtinabangay ang tanan.

nagpahigayon og oplan bulabog ang mga sakop sa cebu city police office-city mobile force company (ccpo-cmfc) uban sa mga personnel sa cebu city transportation office (ccto) dinhi sa dakbayan sa sugbo kagabii hangtud kaganihang buntag biyernes, hulyo 30, 2021.

tumong sa gihimo sa atong kapulisan ug personnel sa ccto mao ang pag rekorida aron pahimangnuan ug pagpasidaan sa katawhan sa siyudad kabahin sa mga safety protocols nga aduna kita’y curfew ug liquor ban ubos sa executive order (eo) no. 136.

base sa eo no. 136 ang curfew gipaubsan gikan sa alas 10:00 sa gabii hangtod alas 4:00 sa kadlawon gumikan sa pagsaka og balik sa kaso sa corona virus disease (covid-19 dinhi sa dakbayan sa sugbo.

ang labing gibantayan karon sa department of health mao ang pagsulod na sa delta variant dinhi sa siyudad ug sa kinatibuk-ang central visayas.

hangyo sa city government sa katawhan nga magmatngon ta kanunay sa akong mga lakaw ug dili mokompyansa og padayong motamod sa mga health protocols nga gipatuman aron malikay nga matakdan sa mas delikado nga virus nga mipakatap na karon sa central visayas.

#pabakunata update: alang sa kasayuran sa tanan, mao kini ang schedule sa atong mga vaccination sites sa cebu city karong adlawa, hulyo 30, 2021.

alang sa wa pa makaparehistro, rehistro lang online pinaagi sa pabakunata.com.

💉noah complex- j&j (exclusive for seniors) and 2nd dose
💉sm seaside- j&j, and 2nd dose
💉uc alcantara- j&j, and 2nd dose
💉robinsons galleria- 2nd dose
💉uc banilad- 2nd dose
💉ayala- closed

tungod sa padayon nga pagtaas sa kaso sa coronavirus disease 2019 (covid-19) dinhi sa dakbayan sa sugbo, nangandam ang cebu city government og pagbutang og dugang nga isolation facility nga ipahimutang sa cebu city sports complex (ccsc) alang sa mga asymptomatic nga covid-19 nga mga pasyente.

temporaryong gisira una ang badminton gym sa publiko tungod kay didto ibutang ang mga higdaanan alang sa mga pasyente.

moabot sa 250 ang bed capacity nga anaa ibutang sa may badminton area nga gi andam alang sa mga covid-19 asymptomatic nga mga pasyente.

sa pagkakaron, padayon gihapon ang gihimo nga pagpangandam sa himuonon nga isolation facility sa ccsc. ang mga sakop gikan sa ccsc nagpadayon og pamutang og mga higdaanan nga gamiton sa mga pasyente.

matod ni usab ni jundel bontuyan, ang manager sa ccsc, ila na usab gihawanan ang mga rooms alang pagpangandam usab kung in case mo saka pamaayo ang kaso ug kung kinahanglan na, andam na ang uban nga mga rooms.

base sa datos gikan sa department of health central visayas (doh-7), sa pagkakarong adlawa, moabot na sa 2,355 ang active cases sa covid-19 dinhi sa dakbayan sa sugbo.

subling gipahimangnuan ang tanan nga magbinantayon ug higpit nga sundon ang mga minimum health protocols sama sa physical distancing, pagsul-ob og facemask ug faceshield, ug magpuyo sa panimalay kung walay importante nga buhaton sa gawas.

due to the continuous rise in cases of corona disease 2019 (covid-19) here in cebu city, cebu city government is preparing to put up an additional isolation facility that will be set up at cebu city sports complex (ccsc) for asymptomatic covid-19 patients.

the badminton gym was temporarily demolished to the public because the beds were put there for the patients.

up to 250 the bed capacity available in the badminton area prepared for covid-19 asymptomatic patients.

as of now, preparations are still being made at ccsc's practical isolation facility. members from ccsc continue to lay beds for patients to use.

jundel bontuyan, the manager of ccsc, said again, they have left the rooms for preparation also if in case you go up the case and when needed, the rest of the rooms are ready.

based on data from department of health central visayas (doh-7), as of today, the active cases of covid-19 will be up to 2,355 here in cebu city.

subling is encouraged to all be vigilant and strictly follow minimum health protocols such as physical distancing, wear a face mask and faceshield, and stay at home when there is nothing important to do outside.

#pabakunata update: alang sa kasayuran sa tanan, mao kini ang schedule sa atong mga vaccination sites sa cebu city karong adlawa, hulyo 29, 2021.

alang sa wa pa makaparehistro, rehistro lang online pinaagi sa pabakunata.com.

💉noah complex- j&j (exclusive for seniors)
💉sm seaside- j&j, and 2nd dose
💉uc alcantara- 1st dose
💉robinsons galleria- 1st dose and 2nd dose
💉uc banilad- 2nd dose
💉ayala- closed

ayaw kalimot sa pagdala sa inyong id ug kaugalingong ballpen.

president rodrigo roa duterte convenes several cabinet members to discuss important issues regarding the latest government response on the covid-19 situation amid the delta variant and other matters of national concern.

two days after his 6th and final state of the nation address (sona), president duterte continues with his weekly talk to the people on covid-19 to remind his countrymen on strictly following the minimum public health standards and being vaccinated at the soonest time to contain the further spread of the more contagious delta variant.

with the confirmed local transmission of the variant, the national government and all local government units (lgus) are in full alert to enforce stricter health and safety protocols, including expediting the mass vaccination to priority eligible groups and ensuring that all filipinos, especially in the barangay levels, are adhering to the rules set by the government to stop the virus.

nagkataas ang record sa panagbangga sa mga sakyanan dinhi sa dakbayan sa sugbo.

base sa talaan sa cebu city transportation office (ccto) nga sud lang sa usa ka adlaw niadtong adlaw’ng martes, hulyo 27, 2021, miabot na sa 20 kaso sa panagbangga sa mga sakyanan dinhi sa siyudad.

subay niini, ang ccto nipahimangnu sa mga motorista nga mag-amping ug magbinantayon kanunay sa pagmaneho sa ilang sakyanan diha sa kadalanan.

karon nga nagkataas ang kaso sa covid-19 sa siyudad, limitado na kaayo ang mga ambulansya mao nga hangyo sa ccto nga magtinabangay tang tanan aron malikay sa disgrasya.

records of car crash in cebu city are increasing.

based on the record of cebu city transportation office (cctvo) that in just one day on tuesday, july 27, 2021, there have been 20 cases of car collision in the city.

according to this, ccto has asked motorists to be careful and always vigilant when driving their cars on the streets.

now that covid-19 cases are rising in the city, ambulances are already very limited so ccto requests that we all work together to avoid the accident.

schedule sa bakuna karong adlawa, july 28, 2021.

noah complex- 1st dose j & j
sm seaside - 1st dose j & j, 2nd dose astra
uc alcantara - 1st dose j & j, 2nd dose astra,
robinsons galeria - 1st dose j & j, 2nd dose astra
uc banilad - 2nd dose astra, 1st dose j & j

ang johnsons & johnson para lamang sa mga sr citizen. palihug pagda ug ballpen, id, ug pagtuman sa health protocols.

base sa datos gikan sa cebu city vaccination operations center (voc), moabot na sa 164,256 ang total administered doses sa coronavirus disease 2019 (covid-19) vaccines dinhi sa dakbayan sa sugbo sukad niadtong marso 24, 2021 hangtod hulyo 27, 2021.

based on data from cebu city vaccination operations center (voc), the total administered doses of corona disease 2019 (covid-19) vaccines here in cebu city will be up to 164,256, 2021 to july 27, 2021.

pila ka adlaw nga nagsigi saka ang kaso sa covid-19 dinhi sa dakbayan sa sugbo, ang mga sakop sa cebu city transportation office (ccto) nipahugot sa ilang pagbantay sa mga pampublikong sakyanan pinaagi sa pagpanakop sa nag-overloading.

giawhag sa ccto ang publiko ilabina kadtong sumasakay matag adlaw nga magmatngon kanunay aron malikay kita nga matakdan sa virus sa covid-19.

dugang awhag sa ccto sa publiko nga di nalang mopugos og sakay kun sa tan-aw nila nga puno na sa pasahero ang usa ka pampublikong sakyanan.

mas maayu nga magpabakuna ang tanan aron duna kitay panagang batok sa virus sanglit inyung hinumdoman nga matag adlaw mopauli kamo sa inyong tagsa-tagsa ka panimalay uban sa inyong pamilya nga posibling makatakod kanila.

vaccination schedule sa adlaw nga martes, hulyo 27, 2021.

noah complex- j&j (exclusive for seniors)
sm seaside - j&j (exclusive for seniors) 2nd dose astra
uc alcantara - 2nd dose astra, 1st dose sinovac
robinsons galeria - 2nd dose astra, 1st dose sinovac
ayala- 1st dose sinovac
uc banilad - 2nd dose astra, 1st dose sinovac

palihug pagdala og ballpen ug id inig adto sa vaccination sites. gihangyo usab ang mga magpa-bakuna sa pagtuman sa mga minimum health protocol.

liquor ban ug curfew sa cebu city

gidili na ang pag-inum og mga ilimnong makahubog sa mga pampublikong lugar sa cebu city sud sa usa ka buwan human gipirmahan ni acting cebu city mayor michael rama ang executive order no. 136.

ubos usab sa maong eo, subling gimando ang pag-implementar sa curfew gikan sa 10:00 sa gabii hangtod sa 4:00 sa buntag nunot sa pagsaka sa kaso sa mga nagpositibo sa covid-19 sa syudad.

gihangyo ang publiko sa pagtuman sa maong mga lagda aron kapugngan ang pagsaka pa sa mga kaso sa mga nagpositibo sa covid-19.

president rodrigo roa duterte delivers his 6th and final state of the nation address (sona) at the joint session of the 18th congress (third regular session) on july 26, 2021.

the chief executive fulfills his annual constitutional obligation amid the global health crisis brought by the coronavirus disease 2019 (covid-19). several time-honored practices and protocols usually observed in the sona have been modified to ensure the safety of all the invited guests in the house of representatives.

ang johnson & johnson nga bakuna exclusive lang sa mga senior citizens dinhi sa dakbayan sa sugbo nga human na nga naka-parehistro na sa pabakunata.com.

#pabakunata update: alang sa kasayuran sa tanan, mao kini ang schedule sa atong mga vaccination sites sa cebu city karong adlawa, hulyo 26, 2021.

ang johnson & johnson nga bakuna exclusive lang sa mga senior citizens nga naka-rehistro na sa pabakunata.com.

magsugod na ang cebu city government sa pagbakuna gamit ang single shot nga johnson & johnson nga bakuna ugmang adlawa, hulyo 26, 2021 diha sa noah mega vaccination site.

exclusive lang kini sa mga senior citizens nga naka-rehistro na sa pabakunata.com. gihangyo ang mga seniors sa pagdala sa ilang id.

the presidential communications operations office (pcoo) presents the #laginghandaph public briefing, an inter-agency effort of the pcoo that brings up-to-date and detailed information about the coronavirus disease 2019 (covid-19) pandemic in the country.

the program embraces a whole-of-nation approach wherein guest resource persons answer questions on pressing issues, tackle matters of national concern and provide updates on the current public health crisis. they also discuss the efforts being undertaken by the government to mitigate the effects of covid-19, including the rollout of the vaccination program throughout the philippines.

abli ang tanang vaccination sites sa cebu city karong adlawa alang sa 1st dose ug 2nd dose sa pag-bakuna.

gipahimangnuan ang tanan nga magpabakuna nga magdala og vaild id, kaugalingon nga ballpen, ug padayon nga tumanon ang mga minimum health protocol aron nga malikayan ang pagkaylap sa covid-19.

alang sa mga buot magpa rehistro, i-click lang ang pabakunata.com

abli ang tanan nga vaccination sites nga anaa mahimutang sa university of cebu senior highschool department, banilad, university of cebu senior high school campus sa j. alcantara st., robinsons galleria, sm seaside city cebu, noah complex, ug ayala center cebu karong adlawa, hulyo 22, 2021.

gipahimangnuan ang tanan nga magpabakuna nga magdala og vaild id, kaugalingon nga ballpen, ug padayon nga tumanon ang mga minimum health protocol aron nga malikayan ang pagkaylap sa covid-19.

nagpahigayon og basic training ug orientation ang nursing coordinator sa cebu city medical center nursing service department ug infection control and prevention team kauban ang clinical instructors sa cebu technological university (ctu)-ccmc college of nursing sa mga nurses kabahin sa coronavirus disease 2019 (covid-19) protocol, propper donning ug doffing sa personal protective equipment (ppe) ug hand hygiene.

gipahigayon ang maong training isip pagpangandam sa pagbalik sa mga nursing students’ clinical duty sa ccmc.

president rodrigo roa duterte meets with several cabinet members to discuss the government’s efforts against the coronavirus disease 2019 (covid-19), especially with the recent news on the spike of covid-19 cases in other countries due to the more contagious delta variant. he directs all agencies concerned to review recent policies and to implement existing protocols with greater urgency and necessity.

on matters concerning the rollout of covid-19 vaccines, the president reports that a greater number of filipinos are now willing to be inoculated against the virus. he calls on the national and local government offices to heighten their vaccine information and education campaign in order to…

president rodrigo roa duterte meets with several cabinet members to discuss the government’s efforts against the coronavirus disease 2019 (covid-19), especially with the recent news on the spike of covid-19 cases in other countries due to the more contagious delta variant. he directs all agencies concerned to review recent policies and to implement existing protocols with greater urgency and necessity.

on matters concerning the rollout of covid-19 vaccines, the president reports that a greater number of filipinos are now willing to be inoculated against the virus. he calls on the national and local government offices to heighten their vaccine information and education campaign in order to further increase vaccine confidence among the filipinos.

pahibalo sa tanan

sirado ug walay pagahimuon nga vaccination sa tanang vaccination sites dinhi sa cebu city, ugmang adlawa, martes, hulyo 20, 2021 sanglit naghuwat pa ang city government og dugang supply sa vaccine ug agig pagsaulog sa eid’l adha o feast of sacrifice.

let everyone know

closed and no vaccination will be held at all vaccination sites here in cebu city, tomorrow, tuesday, july 20, 2021 while the city government is still waiting for more supply of vaccine and to celebrate eid ' l adha or feast of sacrifice.

the program embraces a whole-of-nation approach wherein guest resource persons answer questions on pressing issues, tackle matters of national concern and provide updates on the current public health crisis. they also discuss the efforts being undertaken by the government to mitigate the effects of covid-19, including the rollout of the vaccination program throughout the philippines.

cebu city public information office added a new photo.
july 19 at 10:12 am ·
more options

base sa datos gikan sa cebu city vaccination operations center (voc), moabot na sa 139,186 ang total administered doses sa coronavirus disease 2019 (covid-19) vaccines dinhi sa dakbayan sa sugbo sukad niadtong marso 24, 2021 hangtod hulyo 19, 2021.

sa pagkakaron, lima lang ka vaccination sites ang abli. lakip niini ang mga vaccination sites nga anaa mahimutang sa university of cebu senior high school campus sa j. alcantara st., robinsons galleria, sm seaside city cebu, noah complex, ug ayala center cebu.

president rodrigo roa duterte delivers his intervention at session 2: accelerating the region’s health and economic recovery during the asia-pacific economic cooperation (apec) informal leaders’ retreat via virtual convention from new zealand on july 16, 2021.

“the philippines is concerned with increasing north-south divide between the vaccine haves and the have-nots. notwithstanding our commitment to act together, we have somehow managed to turn this crisis into an unforgiving race to immunity. we are aware that more than 80 percent of covid-19 vaccines have gone to the rich countries, leaving the rest of us in the developing world into so little to get by. the great imbalance in vaccine access needs to be rectified. vaccine nationalism must end,” president duterte said in his remarks.

he added, “we must strengthen collaboration in development, manufacturing and distribution of covid-19 vaccines. therapeutics and medical supplies, this is the most urgent given the emergencies of new variants. apec economies must resist imposing barriers to the free flow of vaccines and related essential products. we must stabilize vaccine prices to the level that make them more affordable to developing countries.”

heads of state and government (hos/g) from the 21 apec member economies are attending an additional meeting at their level for the first time in apec’s history to share information on how the region can continue to build on its collective understanding of health response to the coronavirus disease 2019 (covid-19), as well as shape a collaborative economic response.

prime minister jacinda ardern of new zealand is the apec 2021 chair and this year’s theme focuses on three (3) key points: join, work, grow. together.

prior to session 2, president duterte and his fellow apec leaders pose for the traditional leaders’ family photo, this time a simple shot of all the leaders on screen together, with the official apec 2021 virtual background.

president rodrigo roa duterte delivers his intervention at session 2: accelerating the region’s health and economic recovery during the asia-pacific economic cooperation (apec) informal leaders’ retreat via virtual convention from new zealand on july 16, 2021.

“the philippines is concerned with increasing north-south divide between the vaccine haves and the have-nots. notwithstanding our commitment to act together, we have somehow managed to turn this crisis into an unforgiving race to immunity. we are aware that more than 80 percent of covid-19 vaccines have gone to the rich countries, leaving the rest of us in the developing world into so little to get by. the great imbalance in vaccine access needs to be rectified. vaccine nationalism must end,” president duterte said in his remarks.

he added, “we must strengthen collaboration in development, manufacturing and distribution of covid-19 vaccines. therapeutics and medical supplies, this is the most urgent given the emergencies of new variants. apec economies must resist imposing barriers to the free flow of vaccines and related essential products. we must stabilize vaccine prices to the level that make them more affordable to developing countries.”

heads of state and government (hos/g) from the 21 apec member economies are attending an additional meeting at their level for the first time in apec’s history to share information on how the region can continue to build on its collective understanding of health response to the coronavirus disease 2019 (covid-19), as well as shape a collaborative economic response.

prime minister jacinda ardern of new zealand is the apec 2021 chair and this year’s theme focuses on three (3) key points: join, work, grow. together.

prior to session 2, president duterte and his fellow apec leaders pose for the traditional leaders’ family photo, this time a simple shot of all the leaders on screen together, with the official apec 2021 virtual background.

uswag, pinas! special edition features the mass vaccination against the coronavirus disease 2019 (covid-19) in tacloban city, leyte – known as the gateway to eastern visayas – as it strives to achieve population protection within the year.

today’s episode also focuses on three (3) medical experts from israel who visited the philippines from june 20 to 25, 2021 in order to help the government in coming up with effective strategies on vaccine deployment, efficient cold chain and logistics practices, and reporting and data management strategies.

derived from the bisayan term ‘uswag’ which means progress, this special edition of the social media program aims to inform viewers about the ongoing vaccination in different communities across the nation, the tireless efforts of healthcare workers and medical frontliners in battling the virus, and interviews from inoculated filipinos and medical experts on the benefits of getting the jab to further boost vaccine confidence amongst the people.

uswag, pinas! special edition is a flagship program of the presidential broadcast staff – radio television malacañang (rtvm).

press release
july 15, 2021

coa renders highest audit rating to cebu city despite audit observations

despite a number of audit observations cited by the commission on audit (coa), cebu city still received the highest audit rating from the agency.

the unmodified opinion rendered by coa on cebu city’s financial statements for 2020 is proof that the audit observations were, in fact, already satisfactorily remedied and answered by the city government.

city administrator floro casas, jr. explained that the audit observations made by coa serve to guide the city government in its future operations.

“we welcome those observations. these recommendations are good because these will also guide us in the future transactions of the city. we will surely implement those recommendations,” he said.

to recall, the coa, in its annual audit report, gave an “unmodified opinion” on cebu city’s financial transactions for the year 2020. this meant that coa is acknowledging the proactive stance taken by the cebu city lgu in its efforts to mitigate the effects of the covid-19 pandemic on its constituency.

this is the first time, since its charter in 1937, that cebu city received an unmodified opinion from coa, which proves that the city’s financial statements present fairly its financial position, free from any material misstatements.

this means transactions involving public funds were above board despite the very difficult situation the city government faced in responding to emergencies in the early stages of the pandemic.

some critics raised issues on cebu city’s audit rating, saying that the coa still cited discrepancies in the city’s transactions in its report.

however, the office of the city accountant explained that the fact that the coa still rendered an unmodified opinion to cebu city shows that the city government were able to significantly address these concerns.

as a matter of fact, coa said in its report, “we believe that the audit evidence we have obtained is sufficient and appropriate to provide a basis for our unmodified opinion.”

coa state auditor v maria daisy bercede noted in an independent auditor's report sent to mayor edgardo labella that “the city’s financial statements present fairly, in all material respects, the financial position of the city of cebu as of december 31, 2020, and its financial performance, its cash flows, and its comparison of budget and actual amounts for the year then ended in accordance with international public sector accounting standards (ipsas).”

this affirms the city government’s efforts of providing the best service to its constituents while upholding the highest standards of transparency, accountability, and good governance.

coa’s issuance of an audit observation memorandum (aom) is an exercise of their constitutional power, authority, and duty to audit, examine and settle government funds.

an aom is a preliminary audit tool designed to prevent irregular disbursement of government funds. it is clarificatory in nature, allowing the agency head to explain and/or justify its actions.

the issuance of aoms does not, in any way, prevent coa from still rendering a favorable audit opinion on the financial transactions of an agency.

the current cebu city lgu administration under the leadership of mayor edgardo c. labella has proven that it can be the best even during the worst of times.

the presidential communications operations office (pcoo) presents the #laginghandaph public briefing, an inter-agency effort of the pcoo that brings up-to-date and detailed information about the coronavirus disease 2019 (covid-19) pandemic in the country.

the program embraces a whole-of-nation approach wherein guest resource persons answer questions on pressing issues, tackle matters of national concern and provide updates on the current public health crisis. they also discuss the efforts being undertaken by the government to mitigate the effects of covid-19, including the rollout of the vaccination program throughout the philippines.

gi-turn over sa cebu city government ang upat ka toyota hilux pick up nga sakyanan ngadto sa cebu city police office (ccpo) karong adlawa, hulyo 13, 2021 ug mismong si pnp chief guillermo t. eleazar ang midawat diha sa camp sotero cabahug sa gorordo avenue.

si atty. rey gealon, pangu sa city legal office, maoy representante ni mayor edgar labella ug maoy mi-turn over sa upat ka sakyanan ngadto ni pnp chief eleazar ug ccpo director josefino ligan.

lakip sa pinasidungan dinapit sa ccpo mao sila si konsehal philip zafra ug joel garganera, pro-7 director ronnie montejo ug uban pang mga dagkong opisyal gikan sa camp crame.

sa mensahe ni gealon siya nagkanayon nga saludo si mayor labella sa pnp sa serbisyo ug sakripisyo ngadto sa katawhang sugboanon sa padayong pakig-gubat sa covid-19 ingon man sa kampanya batok sa kriminalidad ug illegal drugs.

si gen. eleazar mapasalamaton usab sa city government nga gipanguluhan ni mayor labella sa padayong suporta sa kapolisan.

president rodrigo roa duterte convenes several cabinet members to discuss the coronavirus disease 2019 (covid-19) situation in the country and other matters of national concern.

the president sends his condolences to the families of the soldiers and civilians who perished in a c-130 plane crash in sulu on 4 july 2021. he also expresses gratitude to the civilians of sulu who rushed to the crash site and tried to save as many lives as possible, as well as those individuals who generously extended assistance to the wounded and those who lost their loved ones.

with the emergence of new covid-19 variants, the chief executive stresses that the best defense against the virus is to get vaccinated as soon as possible. as more vaccine supplies continue to arrive in the country, he also urges his countrymen that aside from receiving immunization, they should continue observing health protocols in order to prevent and avoid the spread of the virus.

base sa datos gikan sa cebu city vaccination operations center (voc), moabot na sa 123,851 ang total administered doses sa coronavirus disease 2019 (covid-19) vaccines dinhi sa dakbayan sa sugbo gikan niadtong marso 24, 2021 hangtod hulyo 12, 2021.

ang cebu city government aduna nay unom ka vaccination sites nga anaa mahimutang sa university of cebu senior high school department sa barangay banilad, university of cebu senior high school campus sa j. alcantara st., robinsons galleria, sm seaside city cebu, noah complex, ug ang bag-o nga abli nga vaccination site nga anaa mahimutang sa ayala center cebu.

padayon gihapon ang pagpahigayon og pagpamakuna sa mga residente dinhi sa dakbayan sa sugbo sa tanan nga vaccination sites.

based on data from cebu city vaccination operations center (voc), the total administered doses of corona disease 2019 (covid-19) vaccines here in cebu city will be up to 123,851, 2021 to july 12, 2021.

cebu city government already has six vaccination sites available at the university of cebu senior high school department of barangay banilad, university of cebu senior high school campus in j. alcantara st., robinsons galleria, sm seaside city cebu, noah complex, and the new open vaccination site available at ayala center cebu.

vaccination of residents here in cebu city is still ongoing on all vaccination sites.

gipahimangnuan ni cebu city mayor edgar labella nga di mo-kompyansa ug padayon nga sundon ang mga health protocol sanglit padayon pa gihapon ang pakigbatok sa covid-19.

edgar labella
july 12 at 3:12 pm ·

my dear fellow cebuanos,

with your help and cooperation, padayon natong ma-mitigate ang covid-19 transmission sa atong dakbayan together with the efforts of the cebu city emergency operations center (eoc).

the eoc has continued contact tracing, mass testing, and isolating covid-positive patients all this time samtang ongoing ang atong vaccination program alang sa mga sugbuanon.

our cebu city quarantine center, barangay isolation centers (bics), and quarantine hotels also remain active and on standby even if they have not reached full capacity, aron magpabilin kitang andam throughout the rise and fall of covid-positive cases.

gituman ni cebu city mayor edgar labella ang iyang saad sa mga medical frontliners nga gipadala sa national capital regional kon ncr plus atol sa pagsaka sa kaso sa mga nagpositibo sa covid-19 sa kaulohan human nila madawat ang ilang tag p30,000 nga allowance gikan sa cebu city government karong adlawa, hulyo 12, 2021.

kahinumdoman, niadtong buwan sa abril ning tuiga, ang sugbo nagpadala og mga medical frontliners aron motabang sa mga covid-19 patients sa ncr plus.

atol sa send-off ceremony si mayor labella misaad nga hatagan niya og tag p30,000 ang mga medical frontliners nga nunot sa ilang tulo ka buwan nga pag-serbisyo sa mga covid-19 patients didto sa ncr plus.

moabot sa 80 ka medical frontliners ang makadawat sa maong kantidad.

gibuksan na karong adlawa, hulyo 12, 2021, ang ika-6 nga vaccination site nga gibutang sa cebu city governnent alang sa padayon nga vaccination program dinhi sa dakbayan sa sugbo nga anaa mahimutang sa ayala center cebu, south entrance duol sa uniqlo.

usa ka ceremonial cutting of mask ang gipahigayon alang sa official opening sa maong vaccination site nga gipangunahan ni dr. jeffrey ibones, ang nangulo sa cebu city vaccine operations center ug oic sa cebu city health department, engr. miguel gerson gikan sa department of health central visayas, jia sadol, ang general manager sa ayala center cebu, ug councilor dondon hontiveros.

ang maong vaccination site maka-accommodate og 500 ka mga ka mga magpa-vaccine ug mo-cater sa priority list gikan a1 to a5.

sa pagkakaron, ang cebu city government aduna nay 6 ka vaccination sites nga nahimutang sa robinsons galleria, uc banilad senior highschool department, uc senior highschool campus, sm seaside city cebu, noah complex, ug ayala center cebu.

president rodrigo roa duterte witnesses the arrival of 1,124,100 doses of astrazeneca vaccines from the government of japan as the donated shipment arrives at the villamor air base in pasay city on july 8, 2021.

the president, together with officials from the embassy of japan to the philippines, national task force (ntf) against covid-19 and the inter-agency task force for the management of emerging infectious diseases (iatf-eid), views the crates containing the vaccines and inspects the actual vials in a ceremonial turnover.

the vaccine donation is part of the initiative spearheaded by the government of japan to support southeast asian countries amid the coronavirus disease 2019 (covid-19) pandemic. it forms part of several aids that japan had extended to the philippines from the onset of the pandemic.

since last year, the japanese government supported the country in its covid-19 response through the crisis response emergency loan (cresl), post-disaster standby loan phase 2 (pdsl 2), procurement of medical equipment and laboratory surveillance sites, and a grant for cold chain facility development.

as more supplies of covid-19 vaccines continue to arrive, ntf against covid-19 chief implementer secretary carlito galvez, jr. said the country is expecting 47 million doses of vaccines by the end of august from different manufacturers.

nakuha sa cebu city government ang “unmodified opinion” sa annual audit alang sa tuig 2020 nga gihimo sa commission on audit (coa).

kini maoy unang higayon nga nakuha sa cebu city government ang maong rating nga gihulagway nga maoy pinaka-maayo nga rating gikan sa coa. ang “unmodified opinion” nga rating sa coa nagpasabot nga maayo pagkadala ang pinansyal nga aspeto sa syudad.

si mayor edgar labellamihangop sa maong kalambuan.

cebu city government got the ′′ unmodified opinion ′′ in the annual audit for the year 2020 created by the commission on audit (coa).

this is the first time the cebu city government got this rating that is described as the best rating from coa. coa's ′′ unmodified opinion ′′ rating means the financial aspect of the city is well brought.

mayor edgar labellamihangop in that luxury.

edgar labella
july 8 at 4:56 pm ·

i am happy to announce that for the first time ever, since its charter in 1937, cebu city has received an unmodified opinion from the commission on audit (coa) for our financial transactions for the year 2020.

kini maoy unang higayon nga nakuha sa cebu city government ang maong rating nga gihulagway nga maoy pinaka-maayo nga rating gikan sa coa. ang “unmodified opinion” nga rating sa coa nagpasabot nga maayo pagkadala ang pinansyal nga aspeto sa syudad.

akong gihangop ang maong kalambuan ug nalipay ko nga in my first term of office as mayor, nakuha kini nato nga rating bisan pa man nga padayon ang atong pakigbatok sa pandemya.

in its annual audit report (aar), coa said the city’s financial statements “present fairly, in all material respects,” the financial position and its financial performance, its cash flows, and its comparison of budget and actual amounts for the year then ended in accordance with international public sector accounting standards (ipsas).

kini nagpasabot nga ang pag-gasto sa syudad sa kwarta sa katawhan nahisubay sa mga lagda sa balaod ang pag-gasto sa kwarta sa syudad agig pagtuman sa ipsas.

“we believe that the audit evidence we have obtained is sufficient and appropriate to provide a basis for our unmodified opinion,” tipik sa coa report.

gipahalipayan usab sa coa ang cebu city accounting office tungod sa sayo nga pag-sumitir niini sa financial statement sa syudad niadtong pebrero 11, 2021.

bisan pa man sa giatubang nga problema sa covid-19, the cebu city government showed an increase in its assets and liabilities, including both in its income and expenses, and in its appropriation, allotment, and actual obligations.

nasuta usab sa coa nga nakahuman ang city government og 16 ka mga infrastructure projects ug dunay 13 nga nagpadayong mga proyekto nga mobalor ngadto sa p242, 287, 497.67.

ang maong mga proyekto naglangkob sa pagpalambo sa kadalanan ug mga drainage system sa nagkadaiyang barangay, pagtukod ug pagpalambo sa mga eskwelahan, multipurpose buildings, evacuation centers, hospital ug dormitory, ug pagbutang sa digital traffic system, ug uban pa.

ang coa mopagawas og tinuig nga pag-audit sa mga government offices sama sa cebu city government aron pagsiguro sa transparency ug accountability sa matag buhatan agig pagtuman sa international standards of supreme audit institutions (issai), authoritative international standards on the public sector.

mapasalamaton usab ako atong mga department heads nga naningkamot ug gigamit og sakto ang kwarta sa syudad sa mga proyekto, programa ug serbisyo alang sa katawhan sa syudad.

president rodrigo roa duterte convenes several cabinet members to discuss the coronavirus disease 2019 (covid-19) situation in the country and other matters of national concern.

the president sends his condolences to the families of the soldiers and civilians who perished in a c-130 plane crash in sulu on 4 july 2021, saying that the filipino nation recognizes and shall always remember their deep devotion to duty. he emphasizes that the surviving passengers are given immediate medical attention and treatment, and expresses gratitude to the civilians of sulu who rendered their assistance in rescuing the passengers of the ill-fated event.

on reports regarding the illegal sale of covid-19 vaccines, the chief executive orders the concerned authorities to investigate the matter and press charges accordingly. he reminds his ‘kababayans’ that the covid-19 vaccines given by the government are not for sale and are being administered to the people for free.

president duterte conveys his gratitude to the filipino people for their continued cooperation, as the country remains steadfast in overcoming the challenges brought by the pandemic.
